ComicInfo.Title: Walt Disney Uncle Scrooge: Pie in the Sky
ComicInfo.Summary:
It's Bats, Man!: Donald is a master pest remover, until he meets his match in a bunch of artistic bats.
Snore Losers: Donald has recurring sweet dreams of Scrooge giving him a million dollars. Scrooge has recurring nightmares of giving Donald that same million dollars. A dreamologist has the answer, but will it just make matters worse?
The Bees Have It!: Donald is dead set on having a "proper prideful gentleman's breakfast", consisting of "a spot of tea, a touch of toast, and a dollop of honey". When there is no honey to be found on store shelves, Donald endures great pain and suffering in order to secure some wild honey directly from a hive of many aggressive bees.
Beachhead Bathos: Donald vs. Neighbor Jones in an epic, no-holds-barred sand castle building contest.
Rootin' Tootin' Duck: A myriad of circumstances lead to Donald becoming a hero... as a rodeo clown.
The Amazon Queen: Scrooge has a specific reason for sending Donald (with the boys in tow) to the Amazon to pick up a cursed ancient Amazon necklace, and deliver it to a rich buyer. A reason mysterious enough that the old miser is willing to pay Donald fifty thousand dollars for his services.
Call Off the Wild: Donald tries his hand at Junior Woodchuck animal calls - and wishes he hadn't.
Another Vine Mess: Destitute Donald must contend with a rapidly growing plant, as his house steadily falls apart.
False Economy: Scrooge touts his economic car.
Shooting to the Top: Scrooge takes an unorthodox shortcut to reach the top of a greased flagpole and claim the hundred dollar bill stuck to its top.
Be My Gust: Donald enters a cake-baking contest that is struck by a whirlwind.
Tree's a Crowd: Donald's genteel day with tea and crumpets is continually disturbed by crows and raccoons inhabiting a tree in the duck's yard. The answer? Cut down the tree. But, does anything ever come easy for Donald?
Quick Trim: Scrooge calls a barber for an unusual trim job.
Seafood Blues: Donald hungrily anticipates the food on an ocean cruise, until he boards ship and gets seasick.
The Three B's: Scrooge shows Donald his "Three B" accounting system.
Duel Personalities: Backyard battlers Donald Duck and Neighbor Jones decide to ignore each other - and can't even manage that.
Heavy Duty: A misunderstanding between Daisy and Donald results in Donald putting on a great deal of weight - and suddenly needing to reduce to normal size.
Shaping Up: A run-down Scrooge considers joining a gym but, when he sees the prices, he perks himself up.
The Bright Side: Snowbound in a mountaintop cabin, Donald leads the boys down the steep slopes on a mission for food by using garbage can lids as sleds.
His Money's Worth: Finding himself to be in perfect health, Uncle Scrooge gripes over the amount of medical bills he must pay with no illness or malady to show for it.
Poisoned Palate: Donald briefly entertains the notion of becoming a French chef... VERY briefly.
Lost On a Dog: Uncle Scrooge has the world's only whistling flea, but the flea decides to take a ride on a passing dog.
Tents, Anyone?: Donald and the boys endure many mishaps in their search for the perfect private campsite.
Large Deduction: Uncle Scrooge explains to a tax auditor why he deducts feeding an elephant as an office expense.
Floating Alone: Scrooge tells the story of when he entered the Duckburg hot-air balloon race to Dogalina Island, experiencing a series of slapstick disasters in the process.
Backyard Bet: Donald tries to sucker the boys into mowing the lawn by making a bet, but the boys get to the punchline before Donald does.
Dime Collector: Uncle Scrooge reviews his list of "firsts".
Fly Now---Pay Later: Donald deals with a pesky housefly... in typical Donald fashion.
A Sound Deal: Donald endures much pain and suffering as a door to door salesman for the Blitzkrieg Bugle Works... until he makes one customer very happy.
Tightrope Gag: Donald shows his nephews that "Anybody can walk a tightrope".
A Prickly Relation: Florist Donald finds the perfect office plant for Uncle Scrooge to relate to.
Pie in the Sky: Baron von Strudel, a rival pastry chef from Scrooge's past, schemes to beat Scrooge out of first prize in an antique airplane show.
ComicInfo.Notes: Tagged with ComicTagger 1.6.0a13.dev122 using info from Grand Comics Database on 2024-06-10 22:28:05. [Issue ID 2263422]
